While the typical Black household‚Äôs income has risen since the 1970s, Black households still earn just 62 cents for every dollar earned by white households ‚Äì a difference of ~$30,000 per year.¬† #JECxCBC

https://t.co/fj6PPfH0t3 https://t.co/nHvj9VV3B5
Several other notable convictions have been reached since this push. Let today‚Äôs verdict serve as a strong pronouncement that hate has no place in our society. (3/3)

In many ways, Democratic efforts in Congress were critical to today‚Äôs verdict including passage of @RepGraceMeng‚Äôs COVID-19 Hate Crimes Act, an already aggressive @TheJusticeDept was ordered to expedite reviews of federal hate crimes including Arbery‚Äôs case. (2/3)

Today, a jury confirmed that the three men who murdered Ahmaud Arbery were motivated by racial hatred. Tomorrow marks the two year anniversary of Arbery‚Äôs tragic death, and unfortunately hate crimes and stories like this are ever increasing. (1/3)

Black girls across America should be afforded the same opportunity to see themselves as protectors and perfecters of all our democratic institutions, especially the Supreme Court.

https://t.co/IKlS668ayj

MDIs and CDFIs are lifelines for small businesses & underserved communities; that‚Äôs why I reintroduced my Ensuring Diversity in Community Banking Bill. As we look forward to its advancement, I applaud @FSCDems for being laser focused on expanding financial opportunities. https://t.co/n51rSWiMPd
As we celebrate the chosen birthday of influential abolitionist Frederick Douglass, let us remember that "without a struggle, there can be no progress." #BlackHistoryMonth

Known for her works that address the intersectionality of Black identity, feminism, marginalization & climate change, Amanda Gorman gained notoriety from her poem "The Hill We Climb" read at the 2021 inauguration of @POTUS. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/jesQpxx6A4

From reaching America‚Äôs unbanked to securely delivering humanitarian aid abroad, the potential digital assets present are great. Today‚Äôs @FSCDems hearing on stablecoins was critical to understanding how lawmakers can best protect the public while enabling responsible innovation. https://t.co/aj8w4CUYVD

Thank you @POTUS for making N95 masks free and available.
 
Residents in the district can pick up free masks at Community Healthcare Network 90-04 161st St, Jamaica while supplies last.
 
Go to https://t.co/axnj3lV1n1 for more info

A two state solution is the only way to assure that both peoples are provided the freedom, security and justice they deserve. I think Amnesty International report, due to its purposefully inciteful nature, doesn‚Äôt help that effort.

As Chairman, I have traveled to Israel and the West Bank and have met with Israelis and Palestinians young and old, rich and poor. I have met Israel‚Äôs new government, as well as Palestinian Authority leadership. They both have an enormous amount of work to do.

But, issuing such an inflammatory report - which makes no effort to explain the challenges Israel faces, or the history of the Jewish people - does not do justice in seeking real solutions to the conflict.

The extensive #humanrights reporting about the plight of Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza cannot be overlooked. Demolitions, settlement expansion, arbitrary detentions, harassment and other injustices can and must end.

Amnesty International plays an important role around the world, and civil society needs to be supported and nurtured. But it is clear that even the title of the report is intended to be more inflammatory than a report from Amnesty should aspire to be.

We should not forget, American security assistance, for items such as the Iron Dome missile defense system, protects Jewish and Muslim lives alike. And the bulk of the aid is utilized to defend against foreign attack.

These aren‚Äôt only harmful policy recommendations, but Amnesty International appears to be going out of its way to lobby countries to end their support for Israel. I don‚Äôt support that, nor do the bulk of my constituents, nor does this Congress.

Several of the report‚Äôs policy recommendations, which include ending all US security assistance for Israel and promoting the ‚Äúright of return‚Äù for Palestinian refugees, would threaten Israel‚Äôs existence.

The seemingly biased report issued yesterday by Amnesty International on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict only emboldens those who organize tirelessly to eliminate the Jewish State. https://t.co/YSiEclbRPt

Wishing the NYPD Officer that was wounded a swift recovery.

The rise of gun violence and violent crimes is a public health crisis. Residents in the Rockaways and all over the city should feel safe. https://t.co/ldsk6yIlNA
Happy Lunar New Year! As we enter this #YearoftheTiger, may you carry bravery and strength as we overcome the current pandemic. Wishing you a year of great prosperity and fortune!

As we enter the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth, we are reminded that change is still deeply needed. The threats that my alma mater @HowardU received are unacceptable. HBCU's are a cornerstone of Black history and Black communities. They must be protected. https://t.co/PfLeNR67rd

The @WhiteHouse released a new, comprehensive resource on @POTUS‚Äôs Bipartisan Infrastructure Law. The guidebook, available at https://t.co/I7N1KvEERN, can help NY communities navigate available funding opportunities and historic benefits.
 
Together, we're #BuildingABetterAmerica
I applaud @POTUS for standing by his commitment to nominate the first ever Black woman to the Supreme Court and look forward to him fulfilling this promise. (2/2)
Supreme Court Justice Breyer has been an exemplary judge and I thank him for his 28 years of service on the bench. I wish him a happy retirement. (1/2)
As Holocaust Survivor Elie Wiesel once said "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference." Today, on #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we remember the six million Jewish lives lost. #NeverAgain

Today marks the 49th anniversary of Roe v. Wade. Reproductive rights and access are still under attack across the country disproportionately harming communities already facing systemic discrimination.

The Senate must pass the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act #WHPA

Go to https://t.co/2LloZQWoL4 to order your FREE at-home COVID-19 rapid antigen testing kits. One order includes 4 individual tests.

- Get vaccinated. 
- Get boosted. 
- Get tested. 
- Wear a mask. 

The only way out of this pandemic is together!

To truly honor #MLK, we must secure voting rights through law. 

Like those who fought against Dr. King‚Äôs vision of America, a minority of Senators have consistently blocked proposals protecting the core of our democracy. 

As I often say, the cameras of history are rolling. https://t.co/omoj70IJYF

The historic nominations of two Black economists to the Federal Reserve is especially pleasing at a time when our country is in dire need of an equitable recovery from a pandemic economy. 

The greater need for diversity at the Federal Reserve is long overdue. (2/2)

I commend @POTUS for nominating Sarah Bloom Raskin as Vice Chair for Supervision to the @federalreserve. If approved by the Senate, she will be the first woman to ever serve in this role and lead the most diverse Fed Board of Governors in its 108-year history. (1/2)

Join me LIVE on Facebook tonight with:

- Elmont Family Health Center 
- Jamaica Hospital
- Joseph P. Addabbo Family Health Center
- St. John‚Äôs Episcopal Hospital 
- NYC Health + Hospitals (Queens)

We‚Äôll chat about COVID-19 and how it‚Äôs impacting their facilities. See you at 5! https://t.co/tirRbAWd9n

Preserving the People‚Äôs power in representative government should override preserving procedure. 

The question before the Senate on the filibuster is this: do you put perfunctory procedure over the People? 

Hanging in the balance is our Democracy itself. #VotingRightsAct

The right to vote is essential to the democracy of the U.S. and if we‚Äôre going to lead in Democratic circles, we should lead by example.

Congress needs to pass #VotingRights reforms. The American people can‚Äôt wait any longer https://t.co/R35h98hXUd

Sidney Poitier lived the American Dream. Of Afro-Caribbean descent, he made theatrical history in classics like ‚ÄúA Raisin in the Sun‚Äù and advanced Black culture on the screen. I pray his family is comforted during this time.  

https://t.co/mr7qd1KU3Z

Today on @BNCNews I discussed my experience on Jan 6, 2021.

Since that day, House Democrats have taken steps to protect our democracy including the passage of the John Lewis #VotingRightsAct. It‚Äôs now time for the Senate to do the same. https://t.co/ZdBq8efn9Q

In the past year, we witnessed more coups worldwide than the previous 5 combined. If we fail to address the threats to our Democracy that Jan 6 put on display to the world, we risk losing not only our moral authority abroad, but our country itself. (12/12)
To do that we must pass the #VotingRightsAct. Ensuring equitable access to the ballot box remains key. And as Chair of @HouseForeign, I‚Äôll be leading efforts to promote Democracy globally. (11/12)

As I reflect on that day, I‚Äôm more determined than ever to prevent another Nadir. The advancements we‚Äôve made as a Nation, and as Black people, must be secured by renewing our commitment to Democracy and promoting racial equality. (10/12)

Given this history, it only made sense that I would be bunkered in my office on January 6 with my Fraternity brother. That day the insurrectionists did more to remind us of our collective purpose in Congress than anything else; it was a call to social action. (9/12)

Despite the grimness of the Nadir, Black institutions like @apa1906NETwork emerged as an act of resistance and source of refuge. Quoting one of our founders: ‚Äúsociety offered us . . . no security. Out of our need, our Fraternity brought social purpose and social action.‚Äù (8/12)

Lynchings and white supremacy were rampant, voting and political rights were denied, and Black codes were enacted forcing the formerly enslaved to choose between unfair labor conditions or jail.  The hopes and promises of Reconstruction were delayed. (7/12)

Alpha emerged during a period of American history referred to as the ‚ÄúNadir of American Race Relations‚Äù coined by historian Rayford Logan. It‚Äôs the period after Reconstruction where we saw significant backlash against efforts to ensure a healthy multi-racial Democracy. (6/12)

Not only does @RepDavidScott share with me the honor of being the first Black Chairman of his Committee, we are both proud members of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity which was founded by Black students at Cornell in 1906 especially for moments like January 6.  (5/12)

So, when I witnessed the insurrection from my office‚Äôs front row seat, I felt a profound sadness - yet, determination. As the violent crowd swelled before my eyes, I got a call from @RepDavidScott, who was seeking a safe refuge to shelter. (4/12)

Buttressing @theBlackCaucus‚Äô work are dozens of Black Subcommittee Chairs and other Members that represent Americans from rural communities to mega metropolises. The week of Jan 6 was indeed a watershed moment in Black political history. (3/12)

The week of Jan 6, Congress certified the US‚Äô resounding preference for @POTUS, and marked the swearing-in of the largest number of Black Members in our history. 6 are now Chairs of @FSCDems @HouseForeign @HouseAGDems @HouseScience @HomelandDems @EdLaborCmte (2/12)

Jan. 6, 2021 began peacefully. As I viewed the Capitol Dome that morning, I reflected on all its history as a structure completed after the Civil War‚Äôs failed insurrection. Little did I know what started off as a calm morning would dissolve into another failed insurrection.(1/12)

Proud to swear in my sister @CMAdrienneAdams, the FIRST Black woman to serve as Speaker of the New York City Council.

This is a historical moment for Queens, for New York City, and for our country.
https://t.co/SnpFhrY5LZ

Today members of the Haitian diaspora celebrate 218 years of freedom. 

Happy Independence Day to the world‚Äôs first Black republic!
#HappyNewYear and welcome to 2022! Here‚Äôs to this being a year of growth and happiness for communities across our country. https://t.co/uGK0A52wMI

My deepest condolences to the family and friends of Sen. Harry Reid. He truly fought the good fight. He was a master legislator and keen tactician; Americans to come will benefit from his life‚Äôs work.

To observers, have a Joyous Kwanzaa! As we reflect on our Seven Principles, also remember our ancestors that continue to guide our steps. Let‚Äôs fulfill their greatest aspirations. https://t.co/tAY9psLFzp
From my family to yours, Merry Christmas üéÑ and Happy Holidays! https://t.co/gvEhijbWEH

Thank you @GovKathyHochul for expanding COVID-19 testing. We are seeing a rise in breakthrough cases. Getting tested can help protect your loved ones during the holidays.

Starting 12/29 you can get free Covid tests at York College. Go to https://t.co/N97flXS8ch for more info

Daunte Wright should still be here with us today. While his loved ones continue to mourn an immeasurable loss, I hope they find peace in today‚Äôs verdict. 

The story of a Black American losing their life to police brutality is one we know too well and hear too often.

The fact of the matter is the Dem. Party is the most forward-thinking. 

Policies we‚Äôve championed, though oft-mischaracterized by others, save lives and grow in demand. Let‚Äôs cut the noise, build on our accomplishments and #BuildBackBetter 

https://t.co/lyxilgWgRK

Today, I joined a #NewDems letter to @SecRaimondo & @AmbassadorTai urging them to expeditiously end Trump‚Äôs tariffs on alum./steel. This policy challenges our trade partnerships when cooperation is key towards promoting our shared interests, easing inflation, & promoting growth https://t.co/iKPaM0P5mA
We are seeing breakthrough cases all over the country and must take all precautions. For those of you who are eligible ‚Äì get boosted! The only way to get through this pandemic is together. (2/2)

The Omicron variant made it very clear that we are not yet out of the dark. Before seeing your loved ones, get vaccinated AND get a COVID test. Limit the size of your gatherings and if you can, social distance and wear a mask. (1/2)

The future of innovation in the financial markets is inevitable.

The use of digital assets can help underserved communities access additional financial tools - but we must make sure there is global coordination around regulation. https://t.co/2DbvTZKMvp

Today, we remember over 2,400 service members and civilians who were killed during the attack on Pearl Harbor.
¬†
We continue to honor their lives and commemorate the bravery and sacrifice of those who fought for our country in the days that followed. https://t.co/OwfvtrMjRI
Happy 115th Founders‚Äô Day to @apa1906NETwork. As Chair of @HouseForeign, I‚Äôll make sure our collective commitment to service remains ALL inclusive and global.¬†¬†ü§ôüèæ https://t.co/iWrvgBNKIn
Omicron or Omarion, either way, please get vaxxed or boosted like you ‚ÄúPost to Be‚Äù.

For those observing Hanukkah, may the lights of the menorah fill your home with¬†brightness,¬†and your hearts with¬†hope and happiness as you celebrate with those you love.¬†

I wish you a #HappyHanukkah and your family a season of love,¬†laughter and¬†light. https://t.co/HVNR3PqnsI

My deepest condolences to the Meek family. I had the honor of overlapping in Congressional service with Carrie Meek. 

At her core, she was an educator and I‚Äôm thankful for all that I learned from her.
From the Meeks family to yours, I hope everyone has a #HappyThanksgiving! Today we give thanks and gather with our family and friends to enjoy this beautiful holiday. https://t.co/IyhghM4YdB

As Ahmaud Arbery‚Äôs family continues to grieve in his absence, I pray that they find some comfort in today‚Äôs verdict, though things will never be the same without him. 

I hope today‚Äôs verdict serves as a strong deterrent to those who find vigilantism and lynching acceptable.

I commend @POTUS on moving forward with the historic nomination of Shalanda Young as OMB Director. Her bipartisan support and her ability to sift through the complexities of government makes her the best candidate for this role. https://t.co/EpjNWaMXay

As @POTUS considers filling other Fed vacancies, diversity in background & thought must be at the forefront. From dynamic labor leaders like @wspriggs to others, there are a plethora of qualified candidates that could help broaden the Fed‚Äôs perspective. (4/4)

Further, Lael Brainard as Vice Chair is an excellent supervisory nomination. I had the benefit of working with her closely on CRA reform and I‚Äôm confident she will be a progressive force on banking regulation.  (3/4)
As our country continues to navigate a pandemic economy, one where inflation has emerged as a new challenge, Powell will be a steady hand that promotes stability during uncertain times. (2/4)
President Biden‚Äôs nomination of Jerome Powell to continue as Fed Chair, and Lael Brainard as Vice Chair is appropriate. (1/4)

Let us not forget that two people died unnecessarily, one injured, and their families are left behind with today‚Äôs judgment, but no recourse. 

Rittenhouse was never the victim here - those making him out to be a hero are degenerates.

https://t.co/bqrRP4xYZl

As someone who grew up in NYCHA, I‚Äôm mostly looking forward to the approx $40 billion towards @NYCHA Housing that will address repairs and affordable housing for families in NYC. 

I look forward to the bill‚Äôs passage in the Senate and its signage into law.

Today @HouseDemocrats passed the #BuildBackBetter Act which will deliver: 

‚úÖ universal pre-k
‚úÖ healthcare 
‚úÖ affordable housing
‚úÖ lower Rx drug costs
‚úÖ climate action 
‚úÖ millions of jobs
Looking forward to doing our part in the House and advancing the #BuildBackBetter Act! https://t.co/Dq0qHA8ViP

This #VeteransDay,¬†we celebrate and honor the millions of men and women who have served our country. 

We thank you for your service today and every day. https://t.co/JKoMpEba7b

Happy 246th Birthday, @USMC

Today and every day, we recognize the men and women of the Marine Corps and the time spent serving our country. Thank you for your bravery and dedication! https://t.co/6BzqyQqDJG

The $1.2 trillion Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill has just passed the House! 

I look forward to @POTUS signing the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill into law and working with my colleagues to pass the #BuildBackBetter Act!

#OTD 53 years ago, Shirley Chisholm became the first Black woman elected to Congress, and later, the first black candidate to run for President of the United States. 

Today, we celebrate her and how her victory has inspired women and African Americans for generations to come. https://t.co/dnr7EwyVKJ

I‚Äôm proud to support @RepMaloney‚Äôs resolution to make Diwali a federal holiday.

For those celebrating, I hope the Diwali lights brighten your life and fill your day with happiness.

Have a blessed #Diwali https://t.co/ASZk5bzw8N

Every vote counts, and your voice matters. New York, be sure to research the five statewide ballot proposals that YOU can vote on today.

Find your local polling place and cast your vote today! https://t.co/laGsJA2Vlr

Looking forward to welcoming @VP to NY‚Äôs 5th Congressional District to discuss our shared goals on climate.   

We must #BuildBackBetter through ambitious reforms. 

https://t.co/SzA4U3gaI8

1 in 3 women and 1 in 4 men have been physically abused by an intimate partner. We recognize survivors and we honor those who have lost their lives.

If you or a loved one are experiencing Domestic Violence, call 1-800-799-SAFE #DomesticViolenceAwarenessMonth

I‚Äôve been working closely with world leaders, my colleagues in Congress, and local officials in NY to push for significant climate policies & bolster resiliency in my district. Let this anniversary be a reminder of the urgency of our mission & the importance of govt action. (4/4)

But our work does not stop there. Last month, Hurricane Ida caused damage & severe flooding across NY. It was a reminder that extreme weather events will only increase in frequency and severity, and we must be diligent in adapting & mitigating the risks to our communities. (3/4)

We rebuilt our city in the years that followed. Federal and local officials worked together to secure disaster relief funding, rebuild housing, assist displaced tenants, and bolster coastal defenses. (2/4)

9 years ago today, New York was hit by the second-largest storm on record, #HurricaneSandy. The superstorm caused $19 billion in damage, flooded 51 square miles, and left nearly 2 million residents without power. Tragically, the lives of 43 New Yorkers were lost. (1/4)

I introduced the #EAGLEAct, to energize US climate leadership and ensure that the most vulnerable in the Indo-Pacific and around the world don‚Äôt see climate impacts exacerbated. The US must lead to hold China, the world‚Äôs biggest emitter, accountable. (4/4)

I also signed onto two letters to the Army Corps of Engineers requesting that funds in the Disaster Supplemental go toward two ecosystem restoration projects that would benefit Jamaica Bay and toward a NY/NJ harbor & tributaries feasibility study. (3/4)

I‚Äôm a co-sponsor of the NY-NJ Watershed Protection Act, which would fund local restoration projects of the watersheds that flow into the NY/NJ harbor, protect wildlife habitats, increase public access, mitigate flood risks, and benefit frontline communities. (2/4)

Passing legislation to accelerate a green energy transition is a top priority for Congressional Democrats. Conducting oversight to ensure that federal funds and programs reach vulnerable communities - including those in my district - is part and parcel with that aim. (1/4) https://t.co/uZuxrkpi6Q

As a Representative of a district severely impacted by extreme storms, I know firsthand the local & immediate consequences of inaction. I know firsthand how poor environmental conditions impact childhood health & development. These realities demand a strong federal response (2/2)

As the second-largest emitter of greenhouse gases, the US plays a critical role in slowing the warming of the planet and saving lives and livelihoods for generations to come by setting an example and reducing emissions here at home. (1/2) https://t.co/1ldtYMX0CX

Climate diplomacy is just one aspect of the international climate change agenda. Our work does not end when @COP26 is over, and it is critical that the U.S. and our global partners remain focused on consistent progress toward our shared climate goals.  (2/2)

In addition to a shared understanding of how our global climate commitments put us on track to meet our ambitious climate targets, I am hopeful that we will collectively leave with renewed motivation and excitement to get to work. (1/2) https://t.co/SVbgIoVEdX

Time is running out to address the climate crisis, which most severely impacts marginalized communities in developing countries, including women, communities of color, & indigenous communities. The @GreenClimateFund targets this by financing developing nations‚Äô climate efforts. https://t.co/hzxOALvRAq

I‚Äôve seen how bottom-up pressure can yield significant progress for a clean energy transition. Creating a global climate revolution takes public pressure & involvement, starting from community-based, climate-friendly practices - at schools, businesses, and places of work. https://t.co/lnhcENAJLp

I stand with Chair @RepBeatty and fellow members of @TheBlackCaucus to ensure that policies benefitting our Black communities are prioritized and included in the #BuildBackBetter Act https://t.co/grwtGyYIF8

Black women are more likely to die from #BreastCancer than any other racial group.  

More likely to be diagnosed with the later-stage disease than other women AND have the lowest survival rates in each stage of diagnosis. 

It's time to change that. #CBCPinkFriday https://t.co/5rfcEnZQig

It takes Latina women two years to earn what white men earn in one year. Latina women only typically earn fifty-seven cents for every dollar earned by white and non-Hispanic men. 

Equal pay for equal work is long overdue #LatinaEqualPay

The #FreedomToVote Act will:

- Ensure free and fair access to the ballot.
- Protect the integrity of our elections.
- Prohibit partisan gerrymandering.
- End the era of big money in our politics.
¬†
The Senate must pass this legislation to protect the fundamental right to vote.

About 1 in 8 women in the United States will develop breast cancer in her lifetime. Remember those who have been diagnosed, and those who have lost their lives to this deadly disease. Early detection is key.  #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth https://t.co/vrfxQ430S0

Glad to see the return of @JeanMontrevil to his family and the community he loves. Shoutout to @das_alina and her colleagues at @nyulaw for their fierce and compassionate advocacy. https://t.co/oLgTvmlTpG

Due to COVID-19, 12 million women across the globe lost access to contraception. On International #DayOfTheGirl we recognize that when girls have equal access to education & health services, they are empowered to transform the world.
Today we celebrate #IndigenousPeoplesDay, by honoring Native cultures, reflecting upon their histories and dedicating ourselves to preserving their future. https://t.co/UZf0NOOn2Y

I support @FSCDems‚Äô Housing Title of the #BuildBackBetterAct that would provide long-overdue investments in housing resources, such as:

üè° Affordable housing

üíµ Downpayment and rental assistance

üè† Efforts to end homelessness
¬†
#HousingIsInfrastructure
My closing remarks from @HouseForeign's briefing on reassessing U.S. policy towards Haiti with Ambassador Foote: https://t.co/8MjBHHx752

I applaud the @usedgov for making loan forgiveness more accessible for public servants. The program has long been riddled with logistical hurdles that don‚Äôt speak to the spirit of the law. This action will bring thousands closer to debt cancellation. 
https://t.co/2UosOpqsLa
Today on #WorldTeachersDay we recognize the efforts and contributions from educators internationally. Thank you to all teachers for everything that you do!
LIVE: Watch @HouseForeign hearing with testimony from key decision-makers spanning our 20 years of war in #Afghanistan. https://t.co/eA8ydyGO8H
LIVE NOW: @HouseForeign Reviews Legislation  https://t.co/g8piyWtxaR

Today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay! It‚Äôs important for Americans to register to exercise their right to vote for our great democracy. Make sure you are registered, help your family & friends to register, or update your voter registration information at https://t.co/RMuxLp9wRp
My full statement on the deportations of Haitian migrants: https://t.co/Ih26G3eaO8

Join me LIVE at 5PM tonight with representatives from @FEMAregion2, @SBAgov, and @nydfs as we discuss relief available to residents and businesses affected by Hurricane Ida in Queens and Nassau County.
¬†
Tune in at https://t.co/9X6B8tptMj

Deportations were halted by the U.S. after Haiti's earthquake in 2010. Today, the Haitian people are fleeing both a natural disaster and political crisis. 

This is a time for humanitarian assistance and relief, NOT deportation.

https://t.co/pKm3L0oa3j
My office is requesting public feedback be e-mailed to habitablehousing@mail.house.gov by October 16, 2021. (3/3)
The discussion draft expands FHA‚Äôs Rehab Program to cover financing of improvements to basement rental units of owner-occupied homes. Read more at https://t.co/Oxz8f1O3Q9 (2/3)

In response to the tragic deaths of 11 New Yorkers who drowned in their basement apartments when Hurricane Ida inundated the City, I released a discussion draft of legislation - the Habitable Housing Conversion Pilot Program Act of 2021. (1/3)
May those observing #YomKippur have an easy and meaningful fast! https://t.co/wQTLYxgW5O

Happy #HispanicHeritageMonth! This month we recognize the history, heritage, accomplishments, and community of Hispanic Americans. Thank you to all Hispanic Americans who contribute every day to this country.

Join me TONIGHT at 6PM with @NYCSchools' Queens South Executive Superintendent Dr. Maurici√®re de Govia, for Congressional and district updates, and a conversation on COVID-19 masks and testing protocols and safety measures in NYC schools at https://t.co/9X6B8t7SUL

Glad I still blend in with the cool kids at Subway. See you on TikTok üíÅüèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Wishing all the new interns a great semester on the Hill! https://t.co/mU3jB5k4DH

Watch @HouseForeign LIVE to hear from 
@SecBlinken about humanitarian concerns, refugee processing and resettlement, and P-2 status updates in #Afghanistan. https://t.co/xFD6nVKxin

On the 20th anniversary we will remember the tragedy, but we will also stand stronger together as a united country. While #WeRemember let us also stay faithful and hopeful for the future of this nation. (4/4)

We will always remember the lives that were lost on September 11th, 2001 and the heroic contributions of our healthcare workers, first responders ‚Äì @FDNY and @NYPD.¬† As well as the taxi drivers and @twulocal100 workers who made sure people got home safely. (3/4)

I still remember the immediate sense of shock and pain I felt trying to process as it was still happening. The dust and smoke that filled the air throughout NYC for days still haunts me. It‚Äôs a day I haven‚Äôt, nor will I ever forget ‚Äì and neither will this country. (2/4)

Today, we commemorate the 20th anniversary of the terrorist attacks on September 11th, 2001. For many New Yorkers it seems hard to believe that it‚Äôs been two decades because we can remember the day so clearly. (1/4)
For more information and additional locations you can go to https://t.co/rbyrjZbZtS or call 1-800-621-3362 or 1-800-462-7585 TTY. (4/4)

For Queens residents, the following Disaster Recovery Center will be open from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily until further notice: 

Queens College, Student Union - 152-45 Melbourne Ave, Flushing, NY 11367 (3/4)

@GovKathuHochul & @FEMA announced NYers who were impacted by Ida‚Äôs devastating floods and storm damage can now receive in-person, one-on-one assistance with professionals equipped to assist in the recovery process. (2/4)

Today @JacksonLeeTX18 and I visited Hurricane #Ida survivors in Hollis and discussed relief efforts with @FEMA officials. 

Businesses and residents need relief immediately and we need to be prepared for the next storm. We simply cannot wait another day. (1/4) https://t.co/5CcL6e57b5

I commend @GovKathyHochul‚Äôs nomination of Adrienne Harris as Superintendent of @NYDFS. Ms. Harris has a strong history of protecting consumers and brings with her a wealth of knowledge and experience that will be critical to the economic growth of NY.

To my colleagues concerned about the price tag of reconciliation: inequality has cost us more. This is a rare opportunity for us to transform this economy. 

https://t.co/EXhapNILDY

I‚Äôm in Queens today with @POTUS and my colleagues in the NYC Delegation as we work on recovery efforts from #Ida
